page.title: 19Leisure activities, Aldridge
page.content: We surveyed 11 year olds to find how they spent their freetime. The most popular occupation was watching television. Some children go to Scouts or Guides where they enjoy organised games and the opportunity to become a Queen's Scout or Guide, the highest honour they could achieve. Many people, mainly boys enjoy fishing, the country's largest participant sport. Some go by themselves, others travel further afield with fathers or other adults. A lot of children play musical instruments. Sport is particularly popular with boys, who can play football or cricket on any piece of open ground as long as there are at least 2 players! Smaller groups enjoy reading, gymnastics, trampolining, drawing and painting. Most enjoy just "playing out"!
